website_summaries.verdict: With everything little ones need to cook up a storm and some enchanting details, this deluxe kitchen set is an ideal option for pint-sized chefs who want a taste of the real thing. Realistic features promise hours of role-playing fun.
pros: Beautifully crafted with excellent attention to detail
Modern design looks just like a miniature version of a real kitchen
Lots of working lights and lifelike sounds make for a realistic and captivating experience
Features an opening fridge, dishwasher, oven, microwave, and washing machine
Sturdy knobs and handles are easy for little ones to grasp
cons: We’d prefer it if the washer had a turning dial rather than a printed image

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves it! I wish the microwave and dishwasher had lights and sound as well... The set comes with many pieces and will take 2-3 hours to assemble. I highly recommend purchasing the stacked washer and dryer. The two sets compliment each other very well. Update 1 year later: Still love this kitchen! Gave it a posh upgrade by adding a peel and stick tile backsplash from Lowes, under cabinet puck lights, and Christmas ornament chandeliers.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my daughters birthday..i recieved a kidkraft desk instead!!! I was very upset since it was in a time frame. Got it shipped again by amazon..& even though this happened i will review the item itself. Let me tell you...5 STARS! more if i could. I love kidkraft. We got bookcases, trunks..tables..and now this. You can tell my daughters face that she loves it. Plays with it all day! My 9year old son plays with her!! Its so realistic! Beautiful. I got her accs from kidkraft and melissa & doug. My husband put in those lights & its an amazing touch!
customer_reviews.author: Paulina Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Compares to expensive sets!
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is adorable! I bought this for my 4 yes old son who aspires to be a chef! He's very tall for 4 yrs but it's just perfect! ( we might put a platform under it as he get taller to get more time from it) The " tile" backsplash is a nice addition and all the doors and buttons make it more realistic for young chefs! If you are looking at the high priced potterybarn sets but don't see spending that kind of cash; buy this! It's worth it! My son LOVES it! It doesn't come with any accessories so you might want to look into some of the Melissa and Doug wooden food sets!
customer_reviews.author: Noah and Gabey-Baby's mom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kitchen but patience is needed during the build!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It's a gift for my son for Christmas! He loves to help me cook. So I thought he would really enjoy this. It does take a good bit of time to put together, so buying it in a timely manner is important! 😂 So glad I read the reviews & didn't wait till the last minute! I added the motion lights to the refrigerator, oven & microwave. 3 for under 14$ here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Ice machine is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got her finger stuck inside the back of the icemaker causing her nail to be pulled up from the cuticle. This kitchen is supposed to be for children, why would you leave a slot behind the icemaker big enough for tiny fingers to get stuck in? I'm very unhappy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Anna's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: My 2yr old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My 2yr old loves it and was definitely worth those 3hrs I watched hubby construct the million piece puzzle. A small drill makes it go so much faster. All the pieces were there and neatly labled. Where ever you put it together should be where its going to stay quality is not light.
customer_reviews.author: amanda grays

customer_reviews.title: Not kid proof. Not satisfactory.
customer_reviews.text: It took awhile to put this together with instructions that jumped around, and certain steps seemed a little unclear, as there are different bolts labeled with the same letter. My son had it for about a week and pulled on the “sink faucet” and it broke off. I took it apart and fixed it, just for it to break a few days later. It broke in several pieces the second time and I had to find all the sharp plastic parts to avoid injury. I would not recommend this for children under five, and it is a little short for children over that age.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS KITCHEN SET
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT..I REPEAT...DO NOT BUY THIS KITCHEN SET. My daughter picked this out for my 3 year old grandchild. I have put many toys together but this was the worst. It had over 50 pieces and many, many screws. The instruction sheet was absolutely horrible to follow...very vague instructions. Just to get the screws out of th. e blister pack without mixing them up was impossible. The screw coding didn't match the diagrams and was missing screws. The last few steps on the instruction sheet were wrong. Stay away from this kitchen set. If you decide to get it, you better hire a carpenter. It took me over 8 hours to build. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by reviews
customer_reviews.text: Where to start, I ordered this for my daughters a couple weeks before Christmas, went to put it together and there were numerous busted pieces inside of a completely UN-damaged box. Needless to say this item was not available for Christmas morning. I requested to exchange the item in hopes of receiving better quality, which didn't happen. Upon receiving the second kitchen set, there were no busted pieces, but the pieces had multiple scratches and ultimately was not worth the money spent. Before you buy, look for used because that is essentially what you're getting with this brand/set.
customer_reviews.author: Collins

customer_reviews.title: What a mess! It took me myself about 8 ...
customer_reviews.text: What a mess! It took me myself about 8 hours to put this beast together, and I needed to start over twice... directions need words.....it is cute and very functional. A bit smaller than I expected for the price. See attached picture of my 23 month old twins and they are on the smaller side height wise ... besides instructions being totally in clear, two color screws labeled the same number, different shapes wood with the same number and one burner not working... it is still crazy cute
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Multiples

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves this kitchen. She gets to cook alongside her mommy and daddy in our kitchen. Now, putting it together took some serious 4hours of work (and my husband builds items all the time), so you will need some patience. Once it was completed, the joy on our daughter's face made it worthwhile. I love how it matches our kitchen too, very modern.
customer_reviews.author: MotherToBears

customer_reviews.title: Time consuming to assemble but well  worth it
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is amazing! My little chef got it for her fourth birthday and it is beautiful, realistic and the perfect upgrade from her older, much smaller kitchen. The only down side was assembly. I don’t think a single piece came attached to anything. It took my husband roughly 5 hours to put it together and he used to work assembling furniture. If you are like me and not good at building stuff, I highly recommend finding someone who can help you before purchasing this. Once it’s built though, it’s worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria E.

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect to get all of your parts...especially if discontinued
customer_reviews.text: Began building this as a santa gift for my kids. Missing two shelves so I can't attach the refrierator and dishwasher doors. Also missing several screws. I was able to order the shelves and write my kids an apology note but the screws are discontinued and can't be sent. I'll have to go to Home Depot after Xmas to buy some screws. This happens so frequently in their packaging they have a whole website dedicated to missing parts. All of the kids Santa gifts hinge around the kitchen (shopping cart, plastic food, play appliances, etc.) and now its in an incompletely assembled pile under the tree. Awful.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vito

customer_reviews.title: Nice, high quality kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built and impressive play kitchen. We bought this as an upgrade to our toddler play kitchen that my kids had outgrown. This took a few hours to put together, as there are many parts and screws, but the instructions are clear and all of the pieces were intact and fit together nicely. My only comment is that the screws that face the outside pieces are painted brown, so they blend in, and are labeled the same as their silver counterparts. Several times I had to go back and replace screws, so keep that in mind when putting this together. These should be labeled differently, or the instructions should indicate which versions to use.
customer_reviews.author: MPR

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service and quality
customer_reviews.text: Kitchen was much smaller than I thought. We put this together on Christmas eve which I do not advise. The holes that were supposed to be pre-drilled were not. All of the screws that came with it were filled in to the point you couldn’t even get a screwdriver in it. I called customer service since the day after Christmas and just now received a response. You cannot call customer service phone number because they won’t answer and leaving a message is completely pointless. This is the second thing I bought from kid craft that was poor quality out of the box and I will never purchased anything kid craft ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this play kitchen! We needed a slightly larger kitchen then the one we had so that our twins could play at the same time. It is still a smaller space for two children but well worth the money and excellent quality as well. It did take my husband several hours to put it together but I feel like it was worth it and they are very favorite Christmas present. I would also like to point out the professionalism of the company we ordered from which is MMP living. They honored the original price it was listed for even when prices went up at Christmas. The best gift our twins could receive!
customer_reviews.author: ashleyb

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: AMAZING..BUT SETUP IS RIDICULOUS!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old seems to really enjoy this over get plastic kitchen. Ill list main pros/cons. PROS: -realistic looking -aesthetically pleasing compared to other kitchens -sounds work -attached laundry was a huge plus for us -decent amount of storage CONS: -This took FOREVER to setup.. I think my husband said a few hours!! It came in a bazillion pieces. It was a process, so I took off a star for that -additional storage would be nice..
customer_reviews.author: Hali

customer_reviews.title: Just like a real kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Our 18 month old granddaughter loves this kitchen and so do all the grownups! The brown color blends perfectly with their family room decor, and the kitchen has everything a real kitchen has. I separately purchased plastic food, plates, and a fantastic British toaster & tea kettle. Assembly was time consuming due to the many pieces, so be sure to organize all the parts in numbered order and segregate all the screws by number in separate cups!
customer_reviews.author: Fanwillow

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for the price. The light-up burners and audio ice-dispenser are huge hits with our kids. There's also a ton of storage for their pretend food/pots/appliances, etc. The complaints in other reviews about assembly instructions and the different-colored screws are legitimate but insignificant. Batteries are included, along with spare parts. Two things: A. You will never be able to change the batteries in the burners once assembled. B. Put on the middle back panels with the tape facing the back of the unit or you'll have big white strips in the cupboards like me (the kids don't care, though).
customer_reviews.author: Matt O

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Little Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I had thought of getting a little kitchen for our granddaughters to play with when they come over. I have a kids’ play area in the finished basement and our girls love to play kitchen/restaurant. Our oldest granddaughter is seven and on the small side, and I was afraid this kitchen might be too small for her, but she’s been having a lot of fun with it. Our younger granddaughter is almost as big as the older one and she loves it, too. This kitchen wasn’t too hard for my husband to assemble, either, which is a plus! It’s a really cute item and I would recommit for any little kid who likes to play cook.
customer_reviews.author: JKat75

customer_reviews.title: This is not a preschool classroom kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I am a preschool teacher, and in my dramatic play center I needed a kitchen. I have 20 students in my class so I need a kitchen more then one child could play at a time. My maintenance man at my time built the kitchen for me. He told me this was a challenge, also he told me he doesn't think this kitchen will hold for years at preschool. I said we will see. Long story short this kitchen is so adorable, it makes sounds, it isn't a good idea to put in a classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. V

customer_reviews.title: My son Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 7 year old son, he absolutely loves it & thats all that matters! It's made of wood which made me excited considering we bought one that was plastic before and it didn't last long. Love how the fridge makes noices as well as the burners. Son was a little disappointed because his last sink actually ran water but may cut out a section to insert a separate sink that can flow water. A little confused one the washer/dryer thing, we was pretty confident it was a dishwasher which would have made a little more sense but it works as well. Overall absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Katelyne

customer_reviews.title: Great for two children to play together and great height!
customer_reviews.text: The best play kitchen for two! After looking at a ton of play kitchens, I decided this one looked the best for two toddlers to play side by side. I wanted a taller one they could grow into as well. This one does all those things and it so cute! Lots of storage too! The ice machine and the stove top makes noise which makes it extra special. It does take a while to put together (similar to putting together ikea furniture), but worth it. It’s also very heavy so build it where you will be putting it.
customer_reviews.author: ASH

customer_reviews.title: Grandma
customer_reviews.text: Grand baby uses every day I put motion detector lights inside fridge ,oven, microwave ect Little sink is removable and water proof-I put some water with ice cubes in it and my 1 1/2 yr old toddler uses a whisk and spoons and plays in it Best toy we ever got for her Very sturdy. Good quality. No dents or paint chipping ect. No warping from the water she splashed on everything
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: We are happy but it took 3 hours to put it together. And its from china.lol
customer_reviews.text: My Grand Daughter will love this for her third birthday. It is from China and it took 30 days to get here. Buy it long before a birthday at least 6 weeks . It is only for folks who are good with hands and strong enough to assemble. It all functions like it should and screw holes matched and parts ,many parts were all there. Allow 3 hours,for man and wife like us to put it together. You need a large table with a blanket to assemble on.It would save your back. We scratched our table so cover it. Just use hand tools so you won't strip out screws. Good luck from brian in baton rouge
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Patience needed, possibly some Tylenol. Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were super easy to follow, although some parts required close attention to detail to make sure you were putting specific pieces in. Overall, I'm extremely happy with this purchase! You need to have patience when assembling, as this did take me 4 hours to complete but totally worth it! Very good quality. Sink came broken, found out KidKraft does not ship to Hawaii. I contacted amazon and they are sending me a replacement sink for me. Awesome service! Great size even for my 5.5 year old. I believe she will get great use out of this for the next several years.
customer_reviews.author: Queenofthree

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The plastic on the burners and ice maker was so brittle that it broke while securing it. Which is not the real problem that I have with KidKraft. I contacted customer service and they told me to fill out a form and they would send me replacement parts. Sounds great- right? Not realy, because after filling out the form they informed me that they do no ship to APO. I received the product via APO. They said they will not honor their warranty because we are outside the USA. So to all soldiers out there do not buy any KidKraft product because they will not honor their warrant while we are overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO Worth it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I knew the build time would be long from the other reviews but boy did it take FOREVER! 5 hours! Also just like everyone else said, it was SO WORTH IT!!!!! It is SO cute!!!! Sturdy, no defects whatsoever. It was a gift for my 3 year olds birthday and she just LOVES IT!! We got all the Melissa and Doug appliances with it, the smoothie blender, mixer, coffee maker, baking set. The Melissa and Doug cookie sheet does not fit but the cupcake set does! We also got the kid Kraft pots and pans set and they fit perfectly and hang up on the knobs above the stove. Worth every hour spent putting it together and every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: If you’re on the fence about this , take the plunge and purchase this kitchen ! it is amazing my son does not leave it , it’s the only toy in his 2 1/2 years I’ve ever bought that captivates his attention for longer than an hour except his bike lol.... it’s took a little longer than 90 minutes to make we used a power drill though and tag teamed it . My biggest and ONLY complaint actually huge complaint is that the microwave / washer doesn’t make noise at all ....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We got the white kitchen for our daughter for Christmas. It was the only thing she asked for and this does not disappoint! It took my husband and I almost 4 hours to put it together, but we were taking our time to make sure it was well put together. It was small enough to maneuver from the garage to the Christmas tree to her room without bumping into any walls. She’s had it for over a month now and we have no complaints. She has had hours of fun and loves to make us food in her kitchen! I was unsure about the price, but after having it, it’s well worth it and beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: MaeRod

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen! Very well built! Kids LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Best kitchen ever! We’ve had this kitchen for about 3 years. It’s held up so well; it looks the same as the day we put it together. We purchased it for our one year old son because he wouldn’t stay out of the real kitchen. Three years later, he still loves it. My nieces and nephews go straight to the kitchen then they come over to play, and even my 16 year old son and his friends have “checked it out” and by check it out, I mean they played with it 🤫 It’s that neat! Buy this kitchen! You and your kiddos won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a kitchen set pretend this is the one!!!
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is the best!!!! It a little pricey but honestly it's so well made and all the working parts like the stove and I've maker! The girls just love it! It has plenty of storage space. Cabinet space at the too of it! It has a microwave and washing machine! It looks like a real kitchen! The detail of it is exceptional!!! Great great buy! If you can have at least two people putting together! while the instructions were easy to follow this isn't least an 40 min to hour long projectbuf well worth it!!! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen for young children
customer_reviews.text: It was very well organized and easy to put together. Everything fit together perfectly. The only issue I had was the lack of instruction about where to use the brown colored screws and silver screws. I noticed there were different colored ones about half way through and it really doesn't matter, but I wish I had noticed sooner because I am a perfectionist. I love that the stove makes noise and looks like a flame and the fridge ice dispenser sounds real. Love this little kitchen! My grandkiddos will get years of play out of it.
customer_reviews.author: pgrtennis

customer_reviews.title: Simply the BEST
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is simply the BEST. Both of my kids can play and not get in each other's way. Make sure you recognize it will take 4 hours and a bottle of wine to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Mullin

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and Fun!
customer_reviews.text: We love this kitchen. I was hesitant about ordering for my son’s 3rd birthday because of all the people commenting on how difficult it was to assemble. My husband is not handy in the least and we managed to get it together correctly during my son’s nap (roughly 2 hours). We took the advice of others and laid every piece out on the floor in numerical order (the pieces all have a number and the hardware have letters assigned) before we began actual construction. In the end, it wasn’t nearly as overwhelming as I was expecting and the outcome was an adorable and realistic kitchen that my son loves.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: These MF’s sent me a REFURBISHED unit. Table top has chips, plastic has scratches, and the phone (as you can see) looks like it was used at a wall ball test dummy. The instructions were not the smartest way to build it. I found myself skipping steps to make it easier cause some spots, you better had a screwdriver that can defy the laws of physics. They give you two “tools” that you only need for 1 step. The entire time you need a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: TIFFANY WOOLERY

customer_reviews.title: Took time to put together, daughter loves it, but one piece came defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 1.5 year old daughter. I put it together myself after my daughter went to bed and took about 4 solid hours. It’s very sturdy and made with great material. My daughter loves it. However, my only complaint is that one of the burners came defective. It doesn’t make any sound. I bought new batteries and still nothing. The other super unfortunate part is that when I unscrewed the burner from the unit so I could replace the batteries, one of the plastic parts that hold the screw in place broke off! I will be contacting KidKraft to see if they replace it. If so, I will update this review on how easy that process was.
customer_reviews.author: BadBeatKing

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter yesterday. Love the design and it's really the best kitchen set but so disappointed in QC. Some parts can’t even last a day (enclose some photos and video. I really love the set but the quality is so disappointed. I feel it’s not worth the money and need to improve on quality. Anything else it's good but takes you some time to assembly. Please make sure you pull the plastic tag for battery for the fridge and stove as it's listed as the last step. which maybe be a headache as you will have to take the stove apart in order to pull the tag.
customer_reviews.author: Yazi L

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from KidKraft!
customer_reviews.text: This shipped with horrible assembly instructions. Took FOUR hours to put together and the instructtions were so difficult to understand that some parts had to be unassembled and then reassembled. The burners are inoperable (no light or sound) and kidKraft doesn't want to honor warranty. They say it will take until April to get parts. Overall, it is not worth the money or the time and frustration. I would send it back, but don't want to take hours to take it apart!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for toddler who loves to get into his mother's kitchen cabinets. He LOVES it and his mother says it keeps him occupied and out of her cabinets. My son-in-law said it took him about 1&1/2 hrs to put together (but he admitted he probably could have done it quicker). I have another kitchen (different layout) that I bought secondhand at a thrift store and keep at my house. All the grandkids enjoy them and each are good quality products. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice and Sturdy kitchen set
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this kitchen set. It’s so nice and very sturdy. I bought this for my daughter and all the kids loves it. I wish I had a kitchen set like this when I was younger. I absolutely love it and it’s a great space saver. The only con was that it took FOREVER to put together ( roughly 3 hours). Some of the screws were very difficult to screw in. I did end up with bruises, scraps and swelling on my hands and fingers when I was done. But the look on her face on Christmas morning made it all worth it. I’d highly recommend this kitchen set.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible kitchen! Fridge, oven, stove, microwave, sink, washer, and space for prepping (which is what convinced me, most kitchens don’t have space to prep food). Lots of storage! It did take about 4 hours to put together, instructions are super easy to follow without ending up with backward things or extra pieces. Super sturd, I’m sure it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Fernanda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Damaged. No response.
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is very cute. Great looking. However building it took nearly 4-5 hours. Some peices weren't cut properly to fit. And MANY of our priced we received were damaged, chipped and dented. We took pictures of it all before building it. Tried to contact the company with no response. It was for our daughters birthday and after putting in 4-5 hours of labor into building it we weren't about to break it down to box it back up for shipping. But zero response from the company to compensate us for the damaged materials. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Scott

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, cute, fun kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This product has easy to follow setup instructions. We did step by step and had it assembled in an hour. The kitchen is sturdy and decorated very nicely. 4 of our grandchildren can play at the same time. We are very happy with the quality and style of the KidKraft kitchen. We also have a KidKraft Everyday Heroes Police & Fire set. The kids all have fun with that, also. It is painted very nicely and is sturdy enough for our autistic male grandchild. We are very pleased with these products.
customer_reviews.author: hiker

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving 4 stars because of the narrow size of the kitchen (the oven doesn't fit any of our wooden food sets) and the way that the cupboard doors don't open and close easily. Perhaps those will loosen a bit over time
customer_reviews.text: Cute kitchen! This is our second KidKraft kitchen, and are familiar with how long it takes to put together (around 2 hours). I'm giving 4 stars because of the narrow size of the kitchen (the oven doesn't fit any of our wooden food sets) and the way that the cupboard doors don't open and close easily. Perhaps those will loosen a bit over time. It's shorter than the classic kitchens, and, again, not deep at all. But it's very, very cute and I don't mind it being in my dining room.
customer_reviews.author: TNC

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous, sturdy kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Best Christmas gift for my two year old grandsons! They play with it each day! Lots of putting together, but if you lay out all of the parts in number order and follow the step by step directions using a drill for the screws, it is completed in over an hour. Three people is perfect...one to hold and give appropriate screws and to give directions, one to use drill, and third to gather the pieces and help hold. Excellent quality. One of my favorite purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K.

customer_reviews.title: All and all, I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, this took me about 3 hours to assemble with just a regular screw driver. It was pretty simple for the most part. The negatives are that it's a little pricey and that I didn't realize until half way through that there were different sets of certain screw, some normal and some with brown tops, so my unit didn't turn out quite as it was supposed to but still worth it. I ended up spending $6 on some tap lights from the dollar store and i think it turned out amazing.
customer_reviews.author: PoofsGone

customer_reviews.title: Such a cute kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute kitchen, although we had some issues. The item was missing several parts (I ordered through Amazon warehouse and knew that the package was damaged). The company has a super easy website for ordering missing parts though. The missing parts were coming out of Texas, and was still here in 5 days! Assembly is a beast. Slightly more infuriating than IKEA. Item is quite small also. I bout it for my 2 year old and it will work fine but it would be too small for kids 6+. Overall, now that it's finally together it's super cute and worth the price I got it for.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Great "little" kitchen for the kids! Just a heads up, there are a LOT of parts stop be prepared up spend some time putting it together. My biggest assembly complaint is that there are screws that have painted heads and the same size screws that don't but they share the same part number. The instructions don't tell you which one to use where so pay careful attention to whether the screws will be visible or not. Unfortunately I didn't catch this early enough so I now have mixed head screws exposed. Also a dishwasher would have been a better fit over the clothes washer, but heck, a two year old doesn't know the difference!
customer_reviews.author: drossman76

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and kids love it
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it’s beautiful! My kids absolutely love it. My 4yo son had a blast and my daughter just turned 2 (her birthday present). They both can play happily with it. Second of all, assembly is...a lot. It’s definitely well designed to make assembly as easy as possible, but it’s just sooooo many parts. I was honestly very impressed with the packaging and assembly process. It was simple but again, just a lot of parts to assemble together. It took me 3 hours to completely put together. Highly recommended. It really is a beautiful play set.
customer_reviews.author: Jane K.

customer_reviews.title: The best toy kitchen ever !
customer_reviews.text: So glad I spent a little more and got this one it’s so perfect and my little girl loves it ! She is 19 months old for size reference and she is in 94% percentile for height so she is on the taller side. She can teach microwave too which is nice. Such a beautiful kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette O.

customer_reviews.title: Cute looking kitchen, but can be dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: My biggest CON comes from the doors, The refrigerator/microwave/oven etc doors. They are VERY hard for a child to open. My daughter has hurt herself in pulling the doors because it is so hard to open them. The clips are hard and my child cannot open them without any help. I have chosen to leave the doors slightly open to avoid anymore injuries. Another con is that the insturctions were hard to follow and the screws came with different colored tops that the instructions did not label or instruct where to use. So that caused our final product to have some silver screws in areas where they should be brown. The kitchen is very cute and modern looking.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Brambila

customer_reviews.title: Came chipped, but my girls love it!
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it four stars because the front of one of the cabinets on the kitchen came to me and was chipped. My girls love the kitchen and I love that they both love cooking in it and all the awesome sounds and features of the stove and icemaker. However, this is not a cheap kitchen. Therefore, I would have liked for there not to have been any chipping of the paint on kitchen parts that are readily apparent. Otherwise it did take quite a bit of time to put together because there are over 100 pieces, but to me it was worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley N Thibodeaux

customer_reviews.title: Toddler's Favorite Present
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old LOVES her kitchen where she can bake, microwave and put all her kitchen/food supplies in the fridge. This play kitchen provides hours of entertainment for her and works as a great storage unit for all of her toys. This unit took me about 4 hours to put together the night before her birthday, which wasn't ideal but seeing her enjoying it endlessly is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Zuzik

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is beautiful! It’s easy to put together, just a little time consuming. Make sure you use the white head screws for the outside. It took about 5 and a half hours to put together but that’s with the added stock on tile backsplash and stock on marble countertops. Bought little storage pieces and command hooks at the dollar store. and motions sensor lights at Walmart for the fridge and oven and above the sink. I do wish it had more drawers or something for storage or a little shelf up top but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Check here for missing spices.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of this kitchen because there was so many 5 star reviews. It seemed too good to be true, right? Well, it’s great! It does take at least 4-5 hours to put together. (But my hubby could have been sneaking a nap too!) It looks nice, good quality, decently sturdy. And I can now finally cook without having to constantly pull the little one off of my counter. It’s helped little ones imagination and independence. We are both so happy with this kitchen. Oh yeah, if you are missing spices or your coffee cup, check the play kitchen, they may have gotten borrowed.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Takes a loooooong time to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This takes a looooong time to assemble but it is absolutely adorable. The only suggestion I have is to make sure you color coordinate your screws with the material you're screwing into and also make sure to remove the battery strip covers before attaching the burners to the stove top. My sons love this kitchen and are playing with it long after Christmas so its a win.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bonme

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece and she loves it! It does come with a lot if pieces though so set aside a few hours to build it. Also, some screws are labeled with the same letter but different colored heads (for the visable spots) but it never specifies when to use which colors which can be very annoying. I also received two of the same little curtain pieces but not a big deal. Otherwise it is well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mars18

customer_reviews.title: Encourages realistic play.
customer_reviews.text: Love this and so does my 2 1/2 yo son. I wanted a realistic looking kitchen, not a plastic one with goofy parts. My son likes to help me in the kitchen already and no he can make things just like me but safely. I wish there were lights in the fridge and stove though. I saw other posts where people have added them and I plan to do the same. If an upgrade for this would have been available I would have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful kitchen....don't wait until Christmas Eve to put it together!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the nicest kids kitchen I have ever seen. My nephews went bananas when they saw this on Christmas morning. Great quality, great details, and a far cry from the play kitchens of my youth! :-) Putting it together definitely required two people and took several hours. There were many points during the assembly process where one of us had to hold two pieces together while the other one screwed in the screws. Make sure you have an electric screw gun/screw driver. They give you extra hardware, which is great. Highly recommend this. Just don't wait until Christmas Eve to put it together...LOL!!
customer_reviews.author: PJHBerry

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Pretty!
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen looks exactly like our kitchen so it matches the room perfectly and isn't an eyesore, which allows us to keep it in an area that allows more realistic pretend play :). This was purchased for my 2 year old son on his birthday. He is a very avg height, no more no less. He loves it! Plays with it daily which is a much needed break from electronics. Again b/c I can store it in the kitchen he plays with it as often as I'm in the kitchen cooking and then some. My husband put it together start to finish in right under 2.5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Mels23

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little Chefs Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: The Good- Great kitchen, sturdy, love all the door that open, that the burners make noise and light up, the ice maker is awesome and love that the faucet moves, great counter space and lots of storage. Not as good- I think it would be nice for the play phone to actually have buttons they can push that make noise and same for the microwave, and I think it would have been cute to have turning nobs for the washer and dryer like they do for the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Z&A Bodenstab

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen set
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit to assemble but the instructions were clear and easy to follow. It's a beautiful addition to my daughters play set! It didn't come with any accessories but the ones I did get were a great addition. She loves her kitchen, especially the burners and ice maker as they make noise. I'm giving a 5 star even after the first one came beat up and broken. It looked like it fell off a 4 story building but Amazon replaced it very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Ambar

customer_reviews.title: Time consuming to put together but well made
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love the look of this kitchen and how it blends in with our home and doesn’t look like a daycare in my living room. My 3 year old loves the noises of the ice machine and stovetop. It took about 5 hours to assemble but it was worth it. I wish it had more sound effects like the pretend phone or sink considering it’s such a big kitchen but it is sturdy and I’m sure will be enjoyed by my youngest when she’s a toddler too!
customer_reviews.author: Kristie A

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kitchen for my two year old daughter for her birthday and she loves it, worth every penny. I read other reviews to see what to expect and I would agree with others who complained about the assembly. My boyfriend put it together and it took him a few hours, though he did take breaks, and he said that the instructions could’ve been a little clearer with the screws. Also, some steps should’ve been done before others because then it made it hard to get screws in tight and hard to reach places. I can’t wait to decorate it for my daughter all cute.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Set!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful and classy play kitchen, perfect for our mini chef! My husband and I were a little nervous when we opened the box and saw the assembly task...but it actually wasn't too bad. We grabbed a couple of drinks and it became a wonderful bonding experience. The pieces are clearly labels and booklet is easy to follow. It probably took us just under 3 hours, but it was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: LOVE - High Quality
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE this little kitchen. My daughter prefers to play here over everything else she got for Christmas. She has recently developed a great imagination for a two year old and this little kitchen has her imagining even more! I love the play encouragement each little feature brings: the phone, light up stove, noise making ice machine, and open and close doors. Everything about this kitchen is high quality! One tip: don’t try to assemble this in less than an hour— or the on Christmas Eve. There are a lot of pieces. Easy to assemble- just takes time.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle K

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: My husband just put this together yesterday for our daughter's Christmas present. It took him a little over 2 hours to complete due to all of the pieces but it is a sturdy piece of "furniture". The ice maker works as well as the stove when you set pots and pans down on the burner. My only concern is the possibility of pulling too hard on the handles and it coming forward. We have it sitting on carpet so it is a bit more wobbly when the doors are opened. I am sure with time those latches will loosen up and we won't have any issues at all. Really well manufactured product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: sully

customer_reviews.title: Awesome play kitchen by KidKraft
customer_reviews.text: I bought this play kitchen for my 5-year old niece for achieving all A's on her report card. She absolutely loves it!!! The kitchen is very sturdy and the assembly instructions were very easy to follow. It was absolutely helpful having watched the assembly tips video provided on Amazon prior to assembling it. I bought the play food, apron and mit, pots, plate set, and motion sensor lights separately. They all made the presentation spectacular. The kitchen was definitely a great buy. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: La-Keisha W.

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen. We had to upgrade to a larger ...
customer_reviews.text: Great kitchen. We had to upgrade to a larger kitchen since we had three girls all interested in playing at once. I got an opened box special for super cheap because I REALLY wanted the white one (Amazon exclusive) and it was missing the sink part, but it was easily shipped to me by Kidkraft. My girls are more than happy with their new set up! We love Kidkraft kitchens and this one does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Carr

customer_reviews.title: If you're not a drinker now, you will be after putting together this item!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the corner kitchen and stack wash/dryer even after reading reviews. They did state put-together-time would be approx. 3 + hours which was true. However, I don't think it was mentioned how confusing the directions were. You obviously had to be a pro at assembly to decipher the missing labeled screws, brown heads/silver heads, short/long, holes that weren't drilled, screws that went in at an angle so you needed to lift weights for a month to have the strength to send them home BUT all-in-all especially after time spent it's not a bad item. Fairly strong and detailed for short kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sleek kids kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about assembling it in my own but It wasn’t too bad putting together. There are a lot of pieces but the instructions are pretty clear and straight forward. The only trouble I had was with 2 of the diagonal pieces because the drill holes didn’t match up perfectly. A drill would’ve been good to have for this reason, instead of making my own hole with a screwdriver. It’s very study and heavy. My toddler loves the ice machine sounds. The doors have quite sharp corners and my toddler has hurt himself on them a few times so be careful of that.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Follow everyone’s advice!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Other reviewers were not exaggerating when they said it takes a long time to build. I followed many of the tips and tricks everyone left. Do yourself a favor and do the same!! I didn’t have many issues other than some holes in the back not lining up. It didn’t affect the kitchen at all. The kitchen is super cute! I highly recommend getting the help of someone. It may go by faster. It took me around 7-8 hours over two days. I added a peel and stick backsplash and contact paper for the counters. It’s trickier than it looks haha Overall, I’m happy and can’t wait to surprise my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Cute but evil
customer_reviews.text: Oh man. This thing was gonna be the death to our Christmas Hahha. It took 5 hours to build because the first few instructions were upside down and it doesn’t tell you that! Took up 2-3 of our hours until we figured out that was why it wasn’t working! And then we were short 2 screws after using the extra screws. But we made do. Cute kitchen. Just would probably not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra time it takes to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is amazing. I needed another person to put this together. The directions are very clear and it is easy, but there were so many steps that it took about 4 hours with two people (trying to do so quietly at night before Christmas). My daughter loves all the sounds it makes and plays with it constantly. I highly recommend. It’s definitely worth the effort of putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Requires alot of assembly, but really cute
customer_reviews.text: Suuuuuuper cute. My daughter loves this! Realistic and well made. I have 2 complaints, though. First, although the instructions are well-organized and easy to follow, theres a LOT of assembly required. My dad is very handy and it took him hours to assemble this. Second, it includes screws to match the wood (some are painted brown) but there arent enough painted ones. So now, some are brown and some silver, which looks a bit odd. Other than these 2 cons, happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Pp

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is amazing! My 2 year old granddaughter and 9 year old daughter love to play in this. Lots of room for both to play. Looks great and all doors open. Ice maker and stove have sounds. Loved that it was able to ship to Hawaii.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I want to give it 5 stars, but there ...
customer_reviews.text: I want to give it 5 stars, but there were a couple damaged pieces, not enough to ask for replacements, but noticeable. Also the instructions need to label which screws to use when! Some screws are painted brown on top to blend in where you can see the screw heads, whereas others are just silver on top. I didn't realize this until half way through, not a huge deal, but I am somewhat a perfectionist so it bothered me a bit that they wouldn't at least tell you when to use a colored top vs silver top screw.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Holy Assembly, Batman!
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is so cute and modern — our daughter is in love with it!! And it’s not an eyesore in our living room. The only complaint is the ungodly amount of screws / bolts, and the 67 steps it takes to assemble. We’re talking several hours. Like a half day. I’m not sure if it was worth it because we don’t have anything else to compare it to, but now that it’s together we love it.
customer_reviews.author: DavCar

customer_reviews.title: RIDICULOUS ASSEMBLY
customer_reviews.text: WHY ARE THERE SO MANY PARTS AND STEPS????? I am good at following directions and putting furniture together, but 4 hours to assemble a tiny kitchen is ridiculous. I should have read ALL of the reviews I guess. This kitchen has a high overall average review, but WHY??? This kitchen is cute, but kind of cheaply made..... The faucet is definitely not going to last long.
customer_reviews.author: AB73

customer_reviews.title: PRACTICALLY PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: This corner kitchen is wonderful! We purchased it months before Christmas and waited to build it for our toddler. It was absolutely worth the wait! Assembly did take a while, but the detailed picture instruction made putting this together rather painless. For sure these products where designed to be sturdy and long lasting. My only wish would be that the stove top counter was printed to look more like a real range rather than matching the print on the other counters.
customer_reviews.author: Ferrol Howell

customer_reviews.title: The cutest little kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is so cute! My daughter loves it. We did have a problem though. The first shipment arrived obviously damaged like it burst open during shipping. It was taped back together recklessly. Upon opening the box, there were pieces that was missing and/ or damaged, and others that had shoe prints on them. I called Amazon and the agent promptly shipped out another. I was a little disappointed because I wanted to surprise my daughter with the kitchen before the holidays but was happy I didn’t have the hassle with trying to send the damaged one back before receiving a new one. The second shipped arrived intact with every piece. The directions were clear, simple and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad we finally bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to purchase this specific kitchen for over a year and finally decided to do it! It took a few hours to assemble but the instructions were good and the screws and such are labeled so it’s easy to keep track of everything even if you leave and come back. My son especially likes the phone, Ice maker and stove top burners, little features like that really set this kitchen apart from other similar ones.
customer_reviews.author: McKell Price

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen - Points to consider
customer_reviews.text: My two cents: When assembling: 1) Get a helper. It makes the assembly process much better. It's very time consuming to put it together by yourself. 2) Make sure not to over tight the screws, otherwise you can cause damage in the product. Suggestions: It would be nice if the counter top part, as well as the stove, had a back protection. When objects fall behind the kitchen, they may end up under neat the kitchen. It's a very complete kitchen set, and my boy loves it, he's having so much fun with it!
customer_reviews.author: Grande

customer_reviews.title: Received in bad conditions
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this for my little one for Christmas. The box got here in a bit of worn conditions so I opened and checked for big breaks. When it came to build for Christmas I noticed over 11 damaged or dirty pieces, the washer door did not close. Opening and closing the doors are not easy for toddlers. Because I got it in white to match her table the details are noticeable. I feel as though I got something that had already been returned. I don’t understand why almost all the pieces were dirty 😒.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I got the package but decided to wait to put it together until Christmas eve do my kids wouldn't see it. Well to my surprise when I open the box it's a white kitchen and not the brown one I ordered. It may not be a dig deal for some but its huge for me. The white kitchen is going to get destroyed in my house. There is nothing that I can do because its Christmas and I spent hours putting it together and I'm not about to take it apart. So I guess we will just have to settle for white. It is pretty solid though. Not a one person job at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah F.

customer_reviews.title: The Faucet WILL BREAK
customer_reviews.text: I was in love with the kitchen at first but knew immediately upon assembling the faucet wouldn't last it wasnt attached good from the beginning..now only a couple weeks later and after already trying to keep it on with aluminum duct work tape its officially broken and im really upset considering its the centerpiece and most prominent focial point of the kitchen and the adding to the fact I paid $200 for it. The faucet really needs to be thought out better by this company.. Id consider making it all one piece so its sturdy. I know im one of many with the same situation.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My 2yo absolutely loves this kitchen. It took a good 4-5 hours to put together but the directions were easy enough to follow. Apparently we were missing one of the brown screws and had to use a silver where it was supposed to be which was a little bothersome to the OCD but it didn't effect anything. I do wish the fridge part had more than one shelf like a real fridge would but that's something we can always make personal changes to. Overall, highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Reese

customer_reviews.title: For a $200 Kitchen NOT worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My husband put this together while I was out of the house so I was shocked to say the least at the overall size of this kitchen when I returned home. The quality of the material is a little better than cardboard and for $200 I'm sorry... I just expected more. I'm contemplating on returning the kitchen... should have went with my first choice...
customer_reviews.author: Angela Holder

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bit hesitant about buying this kitchen for my daughter. As beautiful it is, it was hard for me to pay almost $200 in a toy. However, after reviewing almost 25 kitchens online I decided to go with this one. Is a beautiful kitchen, good quality and I love the sounds and lights! My daughter and her cousins love playing with it! One of the panels came scratch. I contacted Kidkraft immediately and they sent me a replacement without asking a question. I am EXTREMELY satisfied with their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Boldi

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Setup
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this kitchen for our daughter at Christmas. It did take some time to assemble but if you take your time, it comes together very well. The directions are a little misleading at first but look a few steps ahead and it will start to make sense. I would advise to be aware of the brown vs. stainless screw installation. There is an exact quantity of brown screws that will install at exposed connections. My daughter loves playing with this kitchen and I believe that it should last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Three year old daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: It took around 3 hours for me to put it together. Everything seems to be great quality and it’s pretty sturdy. I agree with some of the other reviews that it would be nice if it was labeled when you should use a brown headed screw or a plain one. Overall, it didn’t make much of a difference. There is only one plain one that should’ve been brown that is truly noticeable. My 3 year old daughter absolutely loves it so it was completely worth the time to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Nice play set
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the screws some have white heads which should be used for visible areas no heads up about this in the directions or packing. We only had to swap a few but could have been more annoying if we hadn’t noticed until later. We made a few modifications but set is nice as is. Looking forward to my girls being able to play with this for sometime.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received this for Christmas when she was 18 months(had it for 7 months now) and has played at it everyday since. She absolutely loves it. We bought accessories for it, of course, and she cannot get enough of it. Fairly easy to assemble. I had the thing 3/4 of the way put together and realized I had the bottom tier and middle tier reversed and had to take it apart and start all over, but that was my own fault for not paying attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: James Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great investment. We got it for our 2 year old for her birthday in Nov & she loves it and still plays with it daily. I know she's going to get years of use out of this! Yes, it was a pain to assemble and time consuming. Patience and an electric drill are a must. Some of the pics in the directions could have been more clear (like what color screws to use where) but all in all not the worst assembly to be burdened with.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly L

customer_reviews.title: once the unit was put together it looks very nice and my two girls enjoy playing with it
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you have 2-3 hours of spare time to put this together. For the money I really wish there were more “working” parts. The microwave and the phone for instance should be functional instead of painted on. And instead of the washer/dryer it seems it would have made more sense to put a dishwasher there since KidKraft has a washer/dryer unit that can be purchased separately from the kitchen. That being said, once the unit was put together it looks very nice and my two girls enjoy playing with it. They spend hours entertaining themselves and everyone else in the house with the food they have “made”.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun ahead!
customer_reviews.text: I overall love this kitchen, and so does my 18 month old. The only reason why I did not rate it a 5 was because not everything makes "noise" , like the microwave, washing machine and phone...maybe even the sink would have been really cool as well. Visually however, you cannot beat this kitchen compared to the others. The quality is very good. The one other downside would be that the "hardware" was not packaged individually, so the porthole to the washer was a little scratched up when I took it out of the box all of the hardware came in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for grandkids
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my two grandchildren for Christmas ages 2 and 4. They love! Have spent many happy hours playing house. It was a bit time consuming to put together so read and follow directions and have tools handy. Like the wood and the lights and sounds. Only draw back the 4 year old figured out how to take the knobs off so make sure they are secure. Lights and sounds give this toy the feel of realism just like Moms kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Marian742

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a well made and beautiful kitchen set. It's well worth the price. The instructions were easy to follow, screws were separated and labeled nicely, and all pieces were clearly marked. All of the holes lined up! Assembly was easy for my husband and I though it did take hours and hours! Maybe three or four total? Huge hit with my 7 year old daughter, 4 year old son, and my two year old.
customer_reviews.author: Kidney4Canyon

customer_reviews.title: Great-looking kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy this for my 3-year-old daughter since she seems to enjoy playing with other kids kitchen sets and also I love the look of the kitchen. It is as appealing as my kitchen! My daughter is really enjoying it. I wish that it came with accessories for the cost. Also, it is not easy to assemble. It took my husband almost 5 hours to assemble. There are many pieces needed to put it together. Other than that, it looks just like the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Elan

product_meta.title: KidKraft Ultimate Corner Play Kitchen with Lights & Sounds, Espresso (53365)
product_meta.description: Color:EspressoOur KidKraft ultimate corner play kitchen set With lights and sounds is loaded with fun interactive features to engage your little chefs and keep them cooking. The stovetop burners and ice Maker both feature lights and sounds, oven knobs turn and click and appliance doors really open and close. Functional shelving and cabinets with doors that open and close provide plenty of convenient storage for any KidKraft kitchen accessories. With so much to explore, kids will feel like they're cooking just like mom and dad! Materials - MDF, Solid Wood, Plastic. Made for the ultimate chef in your home, this upscale corner play kitchen is sue to be your little chef’s dream come true. Featuring realistic interactive details that bring the imaginative environment to life, they'll be running the kitchen in no time.
feature_bullets: Speckled granite style counter top; Sink with faucet and taps that turn
Refrigerator, freezer, microwave, oven and dishwasher doors all open and close
Stove-top burners,Ice makers has lights and sounds
Knobs click and turn. Cordless phone with hands-free clip
Convenient storage space below sink;Made of composite wood products

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,230 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
